Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that controls whether responses from the health check middleware can be cached.

remarks.para: The health check middleware does not perform caching of any kind. This setting configures whether the middleware will apply headers to the HTTP response that instruct clients to avoid caching.

If the value is false the health check middleware will set or override the Cache-Control, Expires, and Pragma headers to prevent response caching. If the value is true the health check middleware will not modify the cache headers of the response.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a predicate that is used to filter the set of health checks executed.
Docs.remarks: If is null, the will run all registered health checks - this is the default behavior. To run a subset of health checks, provide a function that filters the set of checks.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a delegate used to write the response.
Docs.remarks: The default value is a delegate that will write a minimal text/plain response with the value of as a string.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a dictionary mapping the to an HTTP status code applied to the response. This property can be used to configure the status codes returned for each status.
Docs.remarks: Setting this property to null resets the mapping to its default value which maps to 200 (OK), to 200 (OK) and to 503 (Service Unavailable).
Docs.exception: Thrown if at least one is missing when setting this property.
